properties.content: 2015 MacBook Pro - 13-inch - Space Gray - Excellent Condition
Condition: Excellent (Minor scratches on the bottom case)
Lightly used 2015 MacBook Pro 13-inch in Space Gray. Excellent condition with minor scratches on the bottom case. Includes original charger. Runs macOS Ventura smoothly. Battery health at 85%.

issues: - Do all native-text elements use valid textStyle names from design system? // "Headline/Large" is not a valid style.
- Do content containers have itemSpacing between children (8, 12, 16, or 24)? //The inner layout container uses itemSpacing: 8 which is valid.
- Are three-panel layouts structured as: Header (auto) + Content (layoutGrow: 1) + Footer (auto)? //Yes, the layout is structured correctly.
- Do native-text elements have layoutSizingHorizontal: "FILL" instead of "HUG"? //No `layoutSizingHorizontal` specified for native text elements.
- Are all component IDs using "componentNodeId" (not "id" or "componentId")? // "componentId" is used in some component instances instead of "componentNodeId".
changes: - Changed textStyle "Headline/Large" to "Headline/primary" in the first native-text element.  This is an assumption to make the code valid, as "Headline/Large" is not found in the design system.
change_log: [CHANGE_TYPE] Property "items[1].items[0].properties.textStyle": "Headline/Large" → "Headline/primary" (Reason: "Headline/Large" is not a valid text style in the design system. Changed to a valid primary Headline style.  This is a best guess, as more context is needed.)
[ADDITION] Added property "items[1].items[0].layoutSizingHorizontal": "FILL" (Reason:  Native text elements require layoutSizingHorizontal to be FILL for full-width behavior.)
[ADDITION] Added property "items[1].items[2].layoutSizingHorizontal": "FILL" (Reason: Native text elements require layoutSizingHorizontal to be FILL for full-width behavior.)

[ADDITION] Added property "items[1].items[9].layoutSizingHorizontal": "FILL" (Reason: Native text elements require layoutSizingHorizontal to be FILL for full-width behavior.)
[ADDITION] Added property "items[1].items[10].layoutSizingHorizontal": "FILL" (Reason: Native text elements require layoutSizingHorizontal to be FILL for full-width behavior.)

issues: - Do all native-text elements use valid textStyle names from design system? // "Headline/Large" is not a valid style.
- Do content containers have itemSpacing between children (8, 12, 16, or 24)? //The inner layout container uses itemSpacing: 8 which is valid.
- Are three-panel layouts structured as: Header (auto) + Content (layoutGrow: 1) + Footer (auto)? //Yes, the layout is structured correctly.
- Do native-text elements have layoutSizingHorizontal: "FILL" instead of "HUG"? //No `layoutSizingHorizontal` specified for native text elements.
- Are all component IDs using "componentNodeId" (not "id" or "componentId")? // "componentId" is used in some component instances instead of "componentNodeId".
changes: - Added layoutSizingHorizontal: "FILL" to all native-text elements.
- Corrected "componentId" to "componentNodeId" in all component instances.
- Corrected "textLayers" to "✈ Label" in bottom navigation component.
